title: THE MORNING MARKET
style_prefix: Children's book illustration, warm painterly style with soft brush strokes. NO TEXT IN IMAGE.

character_refs.layla: Layla - girl with curly dark brown hair, yellow bow on top, teal hoodie with golden sun design
character_refs.riley: Riley - girl with straight dark hair, pink bow, purple dress with white stars
character_refs.ellis: Ellis - boy with blonde hair, blue eyes, orange and blue soccer jersey
character_refs.benny: Benny - friendly brown teddy bear character wearing green plaid scarf
character_refs.mr_mason: Mr. Mason - elderly African American man with gray hair, glasses, blue cardigan

scenes.script: Mr. Mason picked up a small fishing net. It was pretty, with blue thread. 'This came from a fishing village by the sea,' he said.
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason in attic holding up small decorative fishing net with blue thread. Friends watching with interest. Warm attic light.

scenes.script: The attic faded away. Blue sky appeared. White buildings sparkled in the sun. The sea was bright and shiny. Small boats sat in a little harbor.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition - attic fading into Mediterranean fishing village. White-washed buildings, bright blue sea, small colorful boats in harbor. Greek island feeling.

scenes.script: Fishing boats came back to shore very early. The sun was just coming up. Men jumped off the boats. They moved very fast. They carried baskets of fish.
scenes.prompt: Dawn at harbor. Fishing boats arriving. Fishermen jumping off boats with baskets of fish, moving quickly. Golden sunrise light. Urgent energy.

scenes.script: An old fisherman waved at young Mr. Mason. His name was Costa. 'You want to help?' Costa called. 'Then move fast! Fish wait for no one!'
scenes.prompt: Costa waving to young Mr. Mason, calling him over urgently. Already moving fast with fish basket. Energetic elderly fisherman.

scenes.script: Young Mr. Mason helped carry fish baskets. They walked up steep stone steps. Costa moved fast even though he was old. 'Every minute matters!'
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason and Costa carrying fish baskets up steep stone steps. Costa leading despite age. Urgency visible. Morning light.

scenes.script: They set up a stall at the market. They put ice on the table. They put fish on top of the ice. It looked beautiful.
scenes.prompt: Costa and young Mr. Mason setting up market stall. Fresh fish arranged beautifully on ice. Other fishermen setting up nearby. Morning market forming.

scenes.script: The first customers came right away. They wanted the freshest fish. Costa sold to them quickly. They paid full price.
scenes.prompt: Eager customers at Costa's stall buying fresh fish. Costa making sales quickly. Customers happy to pay. Busy morning rush.

scenes.script: For two hours, they were very busy. Young Mr. Mason learned to weigh fish. He learned to wrap fish in paper. He made change.
scenes.prompt: Young Mr. Mason busy at stall - weighing fish on scale, wrapping in paper. Costa working alongside. Learning the trade. Active scene.

scenes.script: By noon, things slowed down. The sun was high and hot. The ice was melting. Fewer people came. Costa looked at the fish that was left.
scenes.prompt: Midday at the stall. Sun high overhead, ice melting. Fewer customers. Costa looking concerned at remaining unsold fish. Time pressure visible.

scenes.script: A late customer came by. Costa sold the last fish for half price. 'Better to sell cheap than throw away,' he said.
scenes.prompt: Costa selling last fish to late customer at reduced price. Pragmatic expression. Better some money than none. Market reality.

scenes.script: Costa explained while they cleaned up. 'Some things don't wait,' he said. 'Fish goes bad. You must know when to move fast.'
scenes.prompt: Costa and young Mr. Mason cleaning up empty stall. Costa explaining wisdom while working. Teaching about timing. End of market day.

scenes.script: Costa gave young Mr. Mason a small net as a gift. 'Remember this. Timing is everything. Not too early. Not too late.'
scenes.prompt: Costa presenting small decorative net to young Mr. Mason as gift. Meaningful gesture. Passing on wisdom about timing.

scenes.script: The seaside village faded away. The attic came back. Mr. Mason was old again. He held the same little net.
scenes.prompt: Magical transition - fishing village fading. Attic returning. Old Mr. Mason now, holding the same small net. Memory preserved.

scenes.script: The friends were quiet. They were thinking. 'So patience is not always right?' one asked. Mr. Mason nodded.
scenes.prompt: Friends looking thoughtful, processing the lesson. Someone asking question. Mr. Mason nodding wisely. Complex lesson about balance.

scenes.script: Benny spoke up. 'So sometimes I SHOULD move fast?' he asked. 'And sometimes I should wait?' Mr. Mason smiled. 'Now you are learning.'
scenes.prompt: Benny having breakthrough realization. Mr. Mason smiling approvingly. Benny learning about when speed vs patience matters. Growth moment.

scenes.script: Ellis helped explain. 'Fish goes bad quickly. So Costa had to sell fast. But other things can wait. You have to read the situation.'
scenes.prompt: Ellis explaining the concept to the group. Analytical thinking. Other friends nodding in understanding. Teaching each other.

scenes.script: The friends thought about their Community Market. 'Food has to be fresh,' said Riley. 'But crafts don't spoil.' 'Art can wait. Cookies cannot.'
scenes.prompt: Friends discussing what this means for their market. Riley and Layla talking about fresh vs lasting goods. Applying the lesson.

scenes.script: Benny nodded slowly. 'I am good at moving fast,' he said. 'That can help sometimes. But I will try to slow down when I need to.'
scenes.prompt: Benny with thoughtful expression, having personal growth moment. Finding value in his natural speed while learning balance. Self-awareness.

scenes.script: Mr. Mason smiled at them. 'You have heard many stories. Morocco. Japan. Italy. The sea. But there are more treasures in this trunk. And Frances has stories too.'
scenes.prompt: Mr. Mason gesturing to trunk, mentioning more stories to come. Friends excited. Journey continues. Teasing Frances's stories.

scenes.script: The friends were excited. They had learned about patience, competition, family work and timing. Their Community Market would be amazing!
scenes.prompt: Four friends gathered around trunk, excited and engaged. All their learnings building up. Market plans growing. Ready for more.
